page.title: 02Villages,Gotherington & Area
page.content: {Gotherington}is a small village of some 400 houses and a population of around 1200. The housing is built mainly alongside the two main roads which makes the village rather long and thin in shape.In the centre of the village is the Village Shop and Post Office and next to that a Butcher's Shop. A bus service serves the village regularly and allows reasonably easy access into Cheltenham. There is also a Primary School which serves the area and a Free Church.The village also has a Village Hall,Boy's Club and Playing Field. The Shutter is the local pub. {Woolstone}is a smaller village to the north and has no shops or bus service. It has got the Parish Church.The road serving the village is a cul-de-sac. {Stanley Pontlarge} is a very small hamlet with very few houses. The church dates back to the Conquest.
